meanings.definition: The condition of having separate carpels in a flower.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the botanist pointed out the apocarpies in the lily.
meanings.sent2: The florist admired the apocarpies in the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The apocarpies in the daisy made it look like a tiny garden of its own.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a garden of apocarpies, each thought a separate bloom.
meanings.sent5: The apocarpies in the rose were like individual treasures waiting to bloom.

meanings.definition: The state of having distinct fruiting bodies.
meanings.sent1: The biologist studied the apocarpies of the mushroom closely.
meanings.sent2: The forest was full of trees with unique apocarpies.
meanings.sent3: The apocarpies of the apple tree seemed to dance in the wind.
meanings.sent4: The field was a patchwork of apocarpies, each plant standing alone.
meanings.sent5: The apocarpies of the pinecone held the promise of new life within them.

meanings.definition: The presence of multiple unfused pistils in a flower.
meanings.sent1: The botanist marveled at the apocarpies of the wildflower.
meanings.sent2: The garden was a riot of colors, each flower showing off its apocarpies.
meanings.sent3: The apocarpies of the sunflower looked like a group of friends standing together.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like apocarpies, each one distinct and separate.
meanings.sent5: The apocarpies of the tulip were like delicate threads holding the flower together.
